Ticket Central’s ‘Weekly Specials’ go on sale on a specific day for a specific performance date and time, so look for these details in each listing.        Valid NYUCard or Alumni ID is required for all purchases.  Only NYUCardholders with full university privileges (dark purple ID color) and alumni with valid Alumni ID (purple and white card with current date) may purchase tickets to theatre, performing arts, sports and other special events on the first day of sale. Classical Voice & Music Theatre Faculty: Matthew Shepard Smith - People - Classical Voice and Opera Studies - NYU Steinhardt                                                      Skip to content         NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development             apply now     request info     contact                                     Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions           Overview        Location     History     Director's Message     International Welcome and History           Academics        Brass Studies     Woodwind Studies     String Studies     Percussion Studies     Jazz Studies     Piano Studies     Music Theatre     Classical Voice and Opera Studies     Music Composition     Scoring for Film and Multimedia     Songwriting     Music Business     Music Technology     Music Education     Music Therapy     Dance Education     Educational Theatre     Performing Arts Administration     Drama Therapy     Summer Programs     Study Abroad     Music Minor           Admissions        Undergraduate     Graduate     Doctoral     Prospective Student Auditions           People        Faculty     Students     Alumni     Staff           Ensembles        Overview     Audition Guidelines     Audition Requirements     Online Audition Registration           Research        ArtsPraxis     Music and the Moving Image     Music and Audio Research Laboratory     Center for Research in Dance Education     Faculty Research Interests     Faculty Collaborations           Events        Facilities        Facilities     Music Technology Facilities           FAQ                 People - Classical Voice and Opera Studies                 Programs       Undergraduate    Master's    Graduate Dual Degree    Advanced Certificate    Doctoral    Summer         Classical Voice Intensive     More Summer Programs           Study Abroad         Curriculum       Undergraduate    Master's    Dual Master's / Advanced Certificate        Auditions   People       Faculty    Students    Alumni        Ensembles   FAQ    Media                    Classical Voice & Music Theatre Faculty: Matthew Shepard Smith                        Matthew Shepard Smith is in his sixth year as an Adjunct Professor of Voice at NYUSteinhardt, Music and Performing Arts Professions. He received his Bachelor of Music from Arizona State University and his Master of Music from Cincinnati College Conservatory of Music. Matthew’s performing career has spanned almost two decades in the New York area. Recently, he played Ralph Sheldrake in the Detroit company of WHITE CHRISTMAS, and he was part of the Kathleen Marshall and Dick Scanlon workshop revival of THE UNSINKABLE MOLLY BROWN in Denver and New York City. Matthew’s Broadway credits include, the title characters in both BEAUTY AND THE BEAST and THE SCARLET PIMPERNEL, and Bob Baker in WONDERFUL TOWN opposite Donna Murphy and Brooke Shields, respectively. He has played Enjolras in the National Tour of LES MISERABLES, and the title character in the European premiere tour of the Maury Yeston/Arthur Kopit DAS PHANTOM. Off Broadway, Matthew starred as Dr. Peterson in the Off Broadway musical, SESSIONS, at the Peter Jay Sharp Theatre on 42nd Street. He also reprised is role, Jim Keenan, in Phil Hall’s play with music, MATTHEW PASSION, at St. John the Devine, in New York City. Other New York credits include Bert, the cop, in The Actor’s Fund presentation of A WONDERFUL LIFE, starring Brian Stokes Mitchell; the concert version of SOUTH PACIFIC at Carnegie Hall starring Reba McIntire and Brian Stokes Mitchell aired on PBS; and the Roundabout’s workshop presentation of 110 IN THE SHADE starring Audra McDonald and Hal Holbrook. Regionally, he appeared in the highly successful SONDHEIM CELEBRATION at the Kennedy Center in Washington, DC, as The Soldier/Alex in SUNDAY IN THE PARK WITH GEORGE starring Raul Esparza. He played the title character in the world premiere presentation of the Leslie Eberhard, David Levy, and Phil Hall version of JEKYLL AND HYDE in Ohio, as well as the title character in the world premiere of Grant Robbin’s GAUGUIN, THE MUSICAL in Chicago. Other regional credits include: Javert in Music Theatre of Wichita’s highly successful production of LES MISERABLES, Duke/Dr. Carrasco in MAN OF LA MANCHA, Peter in COMPANY, Gaston Lachaille in GIGI, Crosby in SWINGING ON A STAR, The Narrator in BLOOD BROTHERS, Baron von Gaigern in GRAND HOTEL, Mike Bailey in SAYONARA and Jim Dillingham in GIFTS OF THE MAGI. He has also been seen numerous times on THE GUIDING LIGHT on CBS. Matthew has soloed with many orchestras throughout the USA, Canada and Europe. He is an active participant in the development of numerous new works at their most infant stages in New York City, in readings and workshops. Matthew lives in Maplewood, NJ with his wife, Elizabeth Mills Smith, and daughter, Madeleine Grace.                  Department of Music and Performing Arts Professions - 35 W. 4th Street, Suite 1077 -  New York, NY 10012 -  212 998 5424    This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©    by New York University. LES MISERABLES                  LES MISERABLES   The classic mega-musical returns to Broadway in a brand new production.       LES MISERABLES    The classic mega-musical returns to Broadway in a brand new production.                  Based on Victor Hugo’s classic novel, Les Miserables is an epic and uplifting story about the survival of the human spirit. The magnificent score of Les Miserables includes the classic songs “I Dreamed a Dream,” “On My Own,” and more!          Tues, 7/1 at 7pm    $57.00 each    Seating TBA    Limit 4 tickets per NYU ID.                    On sale through NYUHome starting 6/24 at 3pm.          YOU MUST PRESENT YOUR NYU ID AND THE CREDIT CARD YOU WILL BE USING TO PURCHASE THESE TICKETS AT TICKET CENTRAL IN ORDER TO CLAIM YOUR TICKETS.        Tickets may be picked up at Ticket Central at least one business day after the purchase is made. Ticket Central’s hours are Tuesday - Saturday, 12pm - 6pm.        DO NOT ATTEMPT TO PICK UP YOUR TICKETS AT THE VENUE.        There are no refunds or exchanges on these tickets.        THERE IS A LIMIT OF 2 TICKETS PER NYU ID for most events. For specific ticket limit information, check out www.nyu.edu/ticketcentral/specials.html. Multiple orders by the same person/ID/credit card will be cancelled and tickets will be resold.                 ​   Arts
